decks.notes: The main strategy of this deck is to aggressively play powerful creatures like Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler while disrupting the opponent's game plan with discard spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck also includes ways to protect its threats with counterspells like Stubborn Denial and removal spells like Fatal Push and Dismember. Liliana, the Last Hope provides additional value by recurring creatures from the graveyard. The deck aims to apply pressure early and control the game through disruption and efficient threats.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal poison counters to the opponent using infect creatures like Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent, supported by pump spells like Mutagenic Growth and Might of Old Krosa. Protection and evasion are provided by cards such as Vines of Vastwood and Distortion Strike. The deck aims to achieve a fast victory by overwhelming the opponent with infect damage before they have a chance to establish a defense. Efficient use of mana acceleration from Noble Hierarch and land fetches allows for explosive turns that can end the game in just a few attacks.

The deck focuses on playing creatures with +1/+1 counters and utilizing cards like Hardened Scales and Steel Overseer to maximize their potential. This allows for explosive plays and overwhelming board presence, often overwhelming opponents before they have a chance to establish their own game plan. Cards like Arcbound Ravager and Hangarback Walker synergize well with the theme of +1/+1 counters, creating an aggressive and resilient strategy that can be difficult for opponents to deal with efficiently. The deck aims to quickly build up a threatening army and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main idea of this Dredge combo deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures like Gravecrawler, Bloodghast, and Vengevine using cards like Faithless Looting and Stitcher's Supplier. Then, utilize cards like Bridge from Below and Greater Gargadon to create an overwhelming army of creatures to overwhelm opponents. The deck also includes a sacrifice outlet like Viscera Seer and finishers like Walking Ballista and Goblin Bushwhacker to close out games. The strategy revolves around explosive graveyard recursion and utilizing synergy between creatures for a fast and deadly combo.

The deck focuses on utilizing Amulet of Vigor to quickly ramp up mana and play Primeval Titan to search for specific lands to create a strong board presence. The combo requires precise sequencing and careful resource management to maximize efficiency. Trinket Mage is used to tutor for key artifacts like Engineered Explosives or Walking Ballista to control the board. Overall, the deck aims to set up a powerful combination of lands and creatures to overwhelm the opponent and establish dominance in the late game.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage engines. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also generating card advantage through cards like Search for Azcanta and Snapcaster Mage. Teferi, Hero of Dominaria provides additional card advantage and can lock the opponent out of the game with his ultimate ability. The win condition of the deck is to either chip away at the opponent's life total with burn spells or secure the game with a large Secure the Wastes token army.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively deal damage to the opponent quickly using low-cost and efficient burn spells, along with fast creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Goblin Guide, and Eidolon of the Great Revel. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Searing Blaze and Lightning Helix, while also utilizing cards like Boros Charm and Skullcrack to bypass any opponent's defenses or prevent life gain. With a fast and consistent strategy, this deck aims to close out games before the opponent can stabilize or mount a strong defense.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Leonin Arbiter and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben while also applying pressure with creatures like Blade Splicer and Thought-Knot Seer. Using flicker effects with cards like Eldrazi Displacer and Restoration Angel allows for additional disruption and value. The mana denial strategy is further enhanced with a land destruction package. This deck aims to win quickly by disrupting the opponent's resources and tempo, while building a board presence that is difficult to deal with.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruption spells. It utilizes strong creatures like Tarmogoyf, Siege Rhino, and Grim Flayer to apply pressure while using cards like Liliana of the Veil and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also has a graveyard recursion theme with cards like Lingering Souls and Traverse the Ulvenwald. By efficiently utilizing its resources and disrupting the opponent's strategy, this deck aims to quickly take control of the game and secure a victory.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying a wide variety of Human creatures onto the battlefield, using cards like Champion of the Parish, Thalia's Lieutenant, and Noble Hierarch to pump them up and overwhelm the opponent. Cards like Reflector Mage and Meddling Mage provide disruption for the opponent's game plan, while Aether Vial allows for quick and efficient deployment of creatures. The mana base is optimized for casting Humans, with cards like Unclaimed Territory and Cavern of Souls ensuring that creatures can be cast easily. With a focus on speed and aggression, this deck aims to quickly close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this UW Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and board wipes while using powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to generate card advantage and control the game. The deck aims to control the board and stabilize the game with cards like Terminus and Supreme Verdict, while also setting up card advantage engines like Search for Azcanta and Ancestral Vision. The win condition is typically through card advantage and incremental advantage gained over time.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly cycle through your deck using cards like Street Wraith and Monstrous Carabid, while using cards like Demonic Dread and Violent Outburst to cascade into Living End, which allows you to return all your creatures from the graveyard to the battlefield. By utilizing powerful creatures like Archfiend of Ifnir and Fulminator Mage, you can quickly overwhelm your opponent and control the board. Additionally, cards like Beast Within and Faerie Macabre help disrupt your opponent's strategy, giving you the advantage in the game.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, while also removing threats with cards like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay. The deck aims to establish a strong board presence with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Scavenging Ooze, while generating card advantage with cards like Dark Confidant and Tireless Tracker. The deck also has access to powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope to control the battlefield and close out the game.

The deck focuses on aggressive play, utilizing efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf, supported by disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and terminate to control the opponent's board while creating pressure. The Planeswalkers, Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope, provide additional value and disruption, helping to grind out the opponent in longer games. The mana base is optimized for consistent casting of spells across all three colors, allowing for flexibility and adaptability in various matchups.

The deck focuses on quickly flooding the board with artifact creatures and utilizing synergy between artifacts to boost their power and toughness. By leveraging artifact lands and efficient mana ramp, the deck can deploy threats quickly and overwhelm opponents with aggressive plays. The key strategy revolves around equipping Cranial Plating to creatures like Vault Skirge and Signal Pest to deal massive damage, while using cards like Steel Overseer and Arcbound Ravager to further enhance the board presence and close out games swiftly.

The main concept of this deck is to efficiently cast a high number of spells in a single turn to build up storm count, allowing for a lethal Grapeshot to finish off the opponent. Utilizing cards like Pyretic Ritual, Desperate Ritual, and Baral, Chief of Compliance to generate mana, while cards like Gifts Ungiven and Past in Flames allow for recursion and card advantage. The deck aims to set up explosive turns where it can chain together multiple spells for a lethal Grapeshot or generate a large storm count to overwhelm the opponent.
